intro: Daucus pumilus var. breviaculeatus, commonly known as the dwarf carrot, is a small biennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, white flowers with a distinctive umbel shape, and its roots are typically short and thick. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and unique characteristics, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
